content: Hi @nikomatsakis. We noticed that when new issues are filed with the 'arm' label, t/compiler-arm doesn't get notified. Apparently someone needs to do an explicit @rustbot ping arm. Could this be made more obvious somehow ? (Or automated!)
We had a bunch of issues reported this week and wanted to make sure nothing slips.
(split into a different topic)
Sorry! My Zulip-fu is weak!
automatic pings for issues labeled arm sounds cool, even though it might get a bit spammy
zulip is like vim: extremely confusing at the start, but you can't leave it once you get familiar with it
Or alternatively just making the need for a rustbot ping more explicit somehow.
if getting notified for every issue labeled arm is something you want maybe that could be implemented with triagebot? @simulacrum

or upside, depending on your POV, but yes

Sorry but my {github/zulip}-fu is weak! Just to be clear: What I was hoping for was that the existing github issue raising protocol (which appears to be adding a label such as 'arm' or 'windows' to the issue) could automatically result in a notification going to the Zulip t/compiler-arm and/or t/compiler-windows streams. So when you good folks say 'subscribes everyone on github' what do you mean exactly ? Thanks!

If you were pinged on GitHub (e.g. labelling O-ARM pings some @O-ARM group in a GitHub comment) then you'd be subscribed to all further updates to the thread - which could be a little spammy if it isn't an issue that you're interested in; in contrast, pinging on Zulip (e.g. labelling O-ARM makes a new topic here and pings you in it) then you'd get a ping once but wouldn't be "subscribed" to it (e.g. wouldn't receive further notifications).
@davidtwco : I see. Thanks!
regardless, the best way to make this happen is to file an issue at rust-lang/triagebot and indicate exactly which style of notification you want, and we can go from there
@simulacrum : Understood, thanks!
